snippet: At least three-quarters of actively managed stock mutual funds regularly failed to beat the broad market index over three, five and 10 years.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column examines studies indicating that majority of actively managed stock mutual funds have failed to outperform Standard & Poor's 1,500-stock index over three, five and 10 years; argues it is exceedingly difficult to pick correct funds, and question remains whether investors should even try.
lead_paragraph: At least three-quarters of actively managed stock mutual funds regularly failed to beat the broad market index over three, five and 10 years.

headline.print_headline: Measure for Measure, Index Funds Rule
headline.main: Measure for Measure, Index Funds Rule
